AccessControlBadConfirmation().details: The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}.

AddressEmptyCode(address).details: There's no code at `target` (it is not a contract).

AddressInsufficientBalance(address).details: The ETH balance of the account is not enough to perform the operation.

ERC1967InvalidImplementation(address).details: The `implementation` of the proxy is invalid.

ERC1967NonPayable().details: An upgrade function sees `msg.value > 0` that may be lost.

EnforcedPause().details: The operation failed because the contract is paused.

ExpectedPause().details: The operation failed because the contract is not paused.

FailedInnerCall().details: A call to an address target failed. The target may have reverted.

SafeERC20FailedOperation(address).details: An operation with an ERC20 token failed.

UUPSUnauthorizedCallContext().details: The call is from an unauthorized context.

UUPSUnsupportedProxiableUUID(bytes32).details: The storage `slot` is unsupported as a UUID.

Initialized(uint64).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

Paused(address).details: Emitted when the pause is triggered by `account`.

RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32.details: Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted signaling this.

RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call, an admin role bearer except when using {AccessControl-_setupRole}.

RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)

Unpaused(address).details: Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`.

Upgraded(address).details: Emitted when the implementation is upgraded.

returns._0: Boolean `true` if the active root can be updated to the proposed root, else `false`.

params._ipfsCid: An IPFS CID pointing to the Merkle tree data. (optional, can be 0x0) Reverts if the distribution with the same id is already exists or Merkle root params are invalid. Reverts if the token is not supported for distribution. Currently only $ORDER and es$ORDER tokens are supported.
params._startTimestamp: The timestamp when this Merkle root become active.
params._token: The type of the token. Currently only $ORDER token and es$ORDER (record based) are supported.

returns._0: The amount tokens claimed so far by that user.

returns.ipfsCid: An IPFS CID pointing to the Merkle tree data (optional, can be 0x0).
returns.startTimestamp: Timestamp when this Merkle root become active.
returns.token: The type of the distributed token. Currently only $ORDER token and es$ORDER (record based) are supported.

returns.ipfsCid: An IPFS CID pointing to the Merkle tree data (optional, can be 0x0).
returns.startTimestamp: Timestamp when this Merkle root become active.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

returns._0: Boolean `true` if there is a proposed root for given distribution waiting to become active, else `false`.
Boolean `true` if the distribution is record based, else `false`.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

params._ipfsCid: An IPFS CID pointing to the Merkle tree data.  Reverts if the proposed root is bytes32(0).  Reverts if the proposed startTimestamp is in the past.  Reverts if the proposed root is already proposed.
params._startTimestamp: The timestamp when this Merkle root become active

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params._distributionId: The distribution id.  Reverts if root updates are paused.  Reverts if the proposed root is bytes32(0).  Reverts if the waiting period for the proposed root has not elapsed.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

BatchPreparedToClaim(uint16).notice: Emitted when admin marks batch as claimable

BatchValorToUsdcRateIsFixed(uint16,uint2.notice: Emitted when admin fixes valor to USDC rate for the batch

DailyUsdcNetFeeRevenueUpdated(uint256,ui.notice: Emmited, when the daily USDC net fee revenue has been updated

DistributionCreated(uint256,uint32,uint8.notice: Emitted when a new distribution is created by the ROOT_UPDATER_ROLE from Ledger chain.

EsOrderUnstake(uint256,uint256,address,u.notice: Emitted when user unstakes es$ORDER tokens

OrderUnstakeCancelled(uint256,uint256,ad.notice: Emitted when user cancels unstake $ORDER tokens request

OrderUnstakeRequested(uint256,uint256,ad.notice: Emitted when user requests unstake $ORDER tokens

RewardsClaimed(uint256,uint256,uint32,ad.notice: Emitted when a user claims rewards from Vault chains.

RootProposed(uint256,uint32,bytes32,uint.notice: Emitted when a new Merkle root is proposed by the ROOT_UPDATER_ROLE from Ledger chain.

RootUpdated(uint256,uint32,bytes32,uint2.notice: Emitted when proposed Merkle root becomes active by the ROOT_UPDATER_ROLE from Ledger chain.

Staked(uint256,uint256,address,uint256,u.notice: Emitted when user stakes $ORDER or es$ORDER tokens

UsdcRevenueClaimed(uint256,uint256,addre.notice: Emitted when user claim collected USDC revenue from chain

ValorRedeemed(uint256,uint256,address,ui.notice: Emitted when user redeem valor for the chain; batchId is the current batch

TREASURE_UPDATER_ROLE().notice: The role, that is allowed to update USDC net fee revenue

accValorPerShareScaled().notice: The accrued valor share, scaled to `ACC_VALOR_PER_SHARE_PRECISION`

batchPreparedToClaim(uint16).notice: Admin marks batch as claimable when USDC is provided for the batch         This also reduce total valor amount and total USDC in treasure         This reduce shouldn't affect the valor to USDC rate because valor and USDC amounts are reduced proportionally

calculateVestingOrderAmount(address,uint.notice: Return amount of $ORDER tokens for withdraw at the moment

canUpdateRoot(uint32).notice: Returns true if there is a proposed root for given distribution waiting to become active         and the start time has passed.

collectedValor(address).notice: The amount of valor token, that has been collected by the user

createDistribution(uint32,uint8,bytes32,.notice: Create a new distribution with the given token and propose Merkle root for it.         Locked for ROOT_UPDATER_ROLE.         Once created, distribution token can't be changed.

dailyUsdcNetFeeRevenue(uint256).notice: CeFi updates the daily USDC net fee revenue          Function reverts, if the function is called too early - less than 12 hours after the last update          to prevent accidental double updates          Function updates the totalUsdcInTreasure, valorToUsdcRateScaled

fixBatchValorToUsdcRate(uint16).notice: CeFi fixes valor to USDC rate for the batch after providing daily USDC net fee amount after batch is finished         This suppose to avoid the last day gap in USDC treasure amount         that can lead to set incorrect valor to USDC rate for the batch         batch.fixedValorToUsdcRateScaled will be set to current valorToUsdcRateScaled

getBatchChainedValorAmount(uint16).notice: Returns the amount of valor that user can redeem for the chain

getBatchInfo(uint16).notice: Returns the batch structure by id without chained valor amount

getClaimed(uint32,address).notice: Get the tokens amount claimed so far for distribution by a given user.

getCurrentBatchId().notice: Calculate and returns the current batch id based on the current timestamp, start timestamp and batch duration

getDistribution(uint32).notice: Get the active Merkle root for distribution id and associated parameters.         If distribution has proposed root and it's start timestamp has passed, proposed root will be returned.         It allows to reduce probability of collision when user claiming rewards from the old Merkle root.         Because it will be updated at the beginning of the next claimReward call and become active from that moment.         So, user will actually obtain the rewards from the proposed root and have to provide amount and proof for it.

getOrderAvailableToWithdraw(address).notice: Get the amount of $ORDER ready to be withdrawn by `_user`

getProposedRoot(uint32).notice: Get the proposed Merkle root for token and associated parameters.         When the proposed root become active, it will be removed from the proposedRoots mapping.         So, this function will return non-zero values only if the proposed root is pending.

getStakingInfo(address).notice: Get the staking balances for a given _user

getUsdcAmountForBatch(uint16).notice: Returns the amount of valor that user can redeem for the chain

getUserRedeemedValorAmountForBatchAndCha.notice: Returns the amount of valor that user redeemed for the chain in the batch

getUserValor(address).notice: Get the pending amount of valor up to now for a given _user

hasPendingRoot(uint32).notice: Returns true if there is a proposed root for given distribution waiting to become active.         This is the case if the proposed root for given distribution is not zero.

isDistributionRecordBased(uint32).notice: Check if the distribution is record based. Currently only es$ORDER token is record based.

lastUsdcNetFeeRevenueUpdateTimestamp().notice: The timestamp of the last update of the USDC net fee revenue

lastValorUpdateTimestamp().notice: The last time that the valor variables were updated

ledgerRecvFromVault((uint256,uint8,uint2.notice: Receives message from OCCAdapter and dispatch it

maximumValorEmission().notice: The maximum amount of valor token, that can be emitted

orderCollector().notice: Address, that will collect unvested $ORDER when user prematurely withdraws

proposeRoot(uint32,bytes32,uint256,bytes.notice: Set the proposed root parameters.         Locked for ROOT_UPDATER_ROLE.         Allows to update proposed root for token before startTimestamp passed.         If startTimestamp passed, proposed root will be propogated to active root.

setValorPerSecond(uint256).notice: Allow the owner to update the valorPerSecond

startTimestamp().notice: The timestamp when the first batch starts

totalStakedAmount().notice: Total amount of staken $ORDER and es$ORDER

totalUsdcInTreasure().notice: The total amount of USDC, that has been collected in the treasure

totalValorAmount().notice: The total amount of valor token, that is currently in circulation

totalValorEmitted().notice: The total amount of valor token, that has been emitted

unstakeLockPeriod().notice: Period of time, that user have to wait after unstake request, before he can withdraw tokens

updateRoot(uint32).notice: Propagate proposed root to the distribution if it can be updated.         Non-reeentrant guard is disabled because this function is called from claimRewards.

updateValorVars().notice: Calculate and update valor per share changed over time

userTotalStakingBalance(address).notice: Get the total amount of $ORDER and es$ORDER staked by `_user`

valorPerSecond().notice: The amount of valor token, that will be emitted per second

valorToUsdcRateScaled().notice: The current rate of valor to USDC

vestingLinearPeriod().notice: Period after lock period, during which vesting $ORDER amount linearly increase from 50% to 100%

vestingLockPeriod().notice: Lock period where user can not withdraw vested $ORDER
